title: Dozens of volunteers canvas Boston for homeless people outside as blizzard bears down on the city
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Volunteers from Pine Street Inn canvassed Boston to assist homeless individuals as a major blizzard hit the city.
The nor'easter, dumping over 16 inches of snow, saw outreach teams providing blankets and transportation to shelters.
Boston shelters, with a capacity of 585, accommodated over 660 people using cots and mats during the blizzard.

title: 50 percent of departing Boston Logan Airport flights canceled Tuesday
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Over 50% of flights out of Logan Airport are canceled Tuesday due to a nor'easter affecting New England.
Nearly 1,000 flights were canceled at Boston Logan Monday with further disruptions expected Tuesday.
Amtrak service from Boston to New York is suspended, with potential resumption Tuesday morning depending on conditions.

title: To trade or not to trade? Bruins must make their call with Viktor Arvidsson.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Viktor Arvidsson has scored 14 goals and 28 points in 45 games since joining the Boston Bruins.
The Bruins, in the final Wild Card spot with a 32-20-5 record, face a trade deadline decision on Arvidsson.
Trading Arvidsson could add draft picks, but his presence is key to Boston's current playoff pursuit.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Tuesday, Feb. 24.
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Massive snowstorm closes over 130 Massachusetts school districts on Feb. 24, with some areas seeing over 30 inches of snow.
Major districts like Boston, Cambridge, and Worcester are among those confirmed closed due to severe weather conditions.
Several school districts, including Athol-Royalston and Littleton, report delays instead of full closures during the storm.

title: AJ Brown recalls ‘critical’ Mike Vrabel moments that changed hatred to respect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: AJ Brown initially disliked Mike Vrabel, writing 'I hate Vrabel' in his notebook during team meetings with the Titans.
Over time, Brown's respect for Vrabel grew as he realized the coach's demanding standards aimed to improve players.
Speculation surrounds a potential Patriots trade for Brown, who is currently under contract with the Philadelphia Eagles.

title: US women’s hockey declines invite to State of the Union, men’s hockey also invited in viral Trump phone call
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: US women's hockey team declined Trump's State of the Union invite due to scheduling conflicts post-Olympics.
US men's hockey team won Olympic gold and was invited to State of the Union and a White House event.
Several men's hockey players, including Zach Werenski, expected to attend Trump's State of the Union address.

title: Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson to save cap space
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots release Antonio Gibson to save over $3 million in cap space, with $1 million in dead money.
Gibson was recovering from a torn ACL and had no guaranteed money in his final contract year.
He played 22 games for New England, contributing 644 rushing yards, 212 receiving yards, and 1 kick return touchdown.

title: Yes, this storm is officially a blizzard. Here’s what meteorologists want you to know.
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Meteorologists declared a blizzard in Massachusetts and Rhode Island, including Boston and Providence, as of Monday morning.
Blizzard conditions require low visibility of 1/4 mile or less and sustained winds of 35 mph for three hours.
The NWS issued a blizzard warning with wind gusts up to 75 mph, making travel hazardous and potentially life-threatening.

title: Video captures blizzard conditions in downtown Boston
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Jack Coen captures blizzard conditions in downtown Boston with stinging gusts and near-whiteout visibility.
Snowfall reached approximately 14 inches in Pawtucket, R.I., with heavier accumulations expected in Massachusetts.
The National Weather Service warns of 18-24 inches of snow and strong winds creating dangerous whiteout conditions.

title: Tom Brady’s WWE comments have landed him at the top of Randy Orton’s RKO list
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tom Brady called WWE 'cute' during Logan Paul's podcast, prompting wrestler Randy Orton to joke about hitting Brady with an RKO.
Randy Orton, who tops the list of celebs he'd RKO, prepares for his 10th WWE Elimination Chamber match this Saturday.
Brady and NFL stars, including Saquon Barkley and Rob Gronkowski, are set to compete in the Fanatics Flag Football Classic.
